TITLE: Replication - Introduction
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 1
CONVERT BREAKS: wysiwyg
ALLOW PINGS: 1
BASENAME: replication---introduction
CATEGORY: Concepts

UNIQUE URL: https://justonesandzeros.typepad.com/blog/2010/08/replication---introduction.html 
DATE: 08/03/2010 08:44:08 AM
-----
BODY:
<p><img src="https://justonesandzeros.typepad.com/images/Concepts2.png" /> </p> <p>Replication.  <br />Replication.   <br />Also known as Connected Workgroups, Replication is the feature where you can create multiple, working copies of the Vault database.&#0160; The main reason you would want to do this is if you have multiple locations working on the same vault where your network latency is too large between locations.&#0160; Replication speeds things up by allowing users to work exclusively with their local location.&#0160; In the background, the data gets synchronized with the other site.&#0160; This article will go into more details on this process because it has an impact on application development.</p> <p>To understand Vault replication, you need to first understand the SQL Server replication since that is the underlying technology.&#0160; As a rule, I try to avoid database details.&#0160; But for replication, that rule is trumped by a bigger rule: <em>Give developers the information they need to write Vault applications.&#0160; </em></p> <p><strong>SQL Server Replication</strong>   <br />In a nutshell, the concept is that you have separate databases on separate servers with the same data.&#0160; This sounds simple, but it&#39;s actually one of the most complex things in database programming.&#0160; </p> <p>As you probably already know, most of the Vault data is in a database.&#0160; So when you are viewing the Where Used on a part file, for example, you are just seeing a representation of a bunch of database rows.&#0160; What SQL Server does is keep track of all the rows that change.&#0160; These changes then get transferred to the other SQL Servers via a background process, and that&#39;s how data stays in sync.</p> <p>One important thing about this transfer: <strong>it is not instantaneous</strong>.&#0160; Even if you have a fast connection, you can expect there to be a delay of at least 1 minute before changes get transferred.&#0160; This delay can also be longer if you have a slow connection or the network is under heavy load.&#0160; </p> <p>Here is where things start getting complex, because it&#39;s possible for data to be legal in one SQL Server but illegal when replicated.&#0160; For example, in Vault, two people on different workgroups add a file called A.dwg to the same folder at the same time.&#0160; Everything works fine until the data is replicated.&#0160; Now you have two files with the same name in the same folder, which violates the rules on how Vault data should be structured.&#0160; Problems like these are called <strong>conflicts</strong>.&#0160; </p> <p><strong>Ownership</strong>  <br />There are various ways to deal with conflicts.&#0160; For Vault, we took the approach of preventing conflicts from happening in the first place.&#0160; We do this through the concept of <strong>ownership</strong>.&#0160; If you want to make <span style="text-decoration: underline;">any</span> edit in Vault, your workgroup needs the proper ownership.&#0160; So my earlier example is not possible.&#0160; You can only add A.dwg to a folder if your workgroup (aka. SQL instance) has ownership of the folder.&#0160; The workgroup without ownership will get an error if the try to add a file to the folder (also, the folder will show up as locked).</p> <p>The granularity of ownership varies depending on what you are working with.&#0160; There&#39;s the concept of <strong>Entity Ownership</strong>, where a workgroup has control of specific entities.&#0160; Files, folders, items and change orders are the only entities that can be owned in this way.&#0160; Everything else uses the concept of <strong>Database Ownership</strong>, which means that a workgroup owns all data in the database which is not controlled via entity ownership.&#0160; This covers things like property definitions, users, groups, categories, and so on.&#0160; Mostly administrator settings are controlled this way.</p> <p>Transferring ownership between two workgroups involves a handshake between the two servers.</p> <ol>
  <li>Workgroup A has ownership.</li>
  <li>Workgroup B requests ownership from A.</li>
  <li>Workgroup A changes ownership to B.&#0160; But this change is only recorded in A&#39;s database.</li>
  <li>Data is replicated to B via the SQL Server background process.</li>
  <li>Workgroup B has ownership. </li>
 </ol>
 <p>Some things to note about this process:</p> <ul>
  <li>Ownership transfer is not instant.&#0160; The requesting workgroup needs to wait for a replication cycle before it has ownership.</li>
  <li>Between steps 3 and 4 things are in a strange state.&#0160; A thinks B has ownership and B thinks A has ownership.&#0160; Effectively, this means that nobody has ownership.</li>
 </ul>
 <p><strong>Leases</strong>  <br />The last concept I want to talk about here is the <strong>lease</strong> concept.&#0160; Basically a lease prevents ownership from being transferred for a set length of time.&#0160; The rationale is that if you just grabbed ownership of something, you probably want to work on it for a while.&#0160; You don&#39;t another workgroup grabbing it away from you a few seconds later.&#0160; So when you transfer ownership, you set a lease period.&#0160; Until that lease expires, nobody can change the ownership.&#0160; Once the lease expires, it is still owned by the same workgroup.&#0160; Only when another workgroup requests ownership will the ownership change.</p> <p>I think by default you have a 1 day lease on entities you create.&#0160; If you grab ownership from somewhere else, you get a 1 hour lease.&#0160; If you have ownership of something, you can fully edit the lease.&#0160; You can extend or shorten the lease time.&#0160; You can remove the lease on an item or you can add a lease on something that does not have one.&#0160; You can&#39;t edit the lease of something not owned by your workgroup.</p>
-----
EXTENDED BODY:

-----
EXCERPT:

-----
KEYWORDS:
Replication, connected workgroups, SQL Server, ownership, lease, entity ownership, database ownership
-----
--------
AUTHOR: Doug Redmond
AUTHOR EMAIL: doug.redmond@autodesk.com
TITLE: Storing Custom Data: Hidden Files
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 1
CONVERT BREAKS: wysiwyg
ALLOW PINGS: 1
BASENAME: storing-custom-data-hidden-files
CATEGORY: Tips and Tricks

UNIQUE URL: https://justonesandzeros.typepad.com/blog/2010/07/storing-custom-data-hidden-files.html 
DATE: 07/26/2010 08:14:10 AM
-----
BODY:
<p><img src="https://justonesandzeros.typepad.com/images/TipsAndTricks2.png" /> </p> <p>Writing <a href="http://justonesandzeros.typepad.com/blog/2010/06/the-recycle-bin-20.html" target="_blank">Recycle Bin 2.0</a> allowed be to get up close and personal with the various issues that come with storing your data as a Vault file.&#0160; Like with my other articles in the <a href="http://justonesandzeros.typepad.com/sitemap.html#StoringCustomData" target="_blank">Storing Custom Data series</a>, there are advantages and disadvantages to this technique.&#0160; It&#39;s up to you to decide what is best for your needs.</p> <p><strong>Hidden Files</strong>   <br />The idea here is that you take your data, serialize it to a file, and check it into Vault.&#0160; The file should be hidden so that it doesn&#39;t confuse end users.&#0160; This technique isn&#39;t fool-proof however, users can adjust their settings so that they can see hidden files.&#0160; So you might also want to set special security on the file so that it can only be edited by your program.</p> <p><strong>Example</strong>   <br />For Recycle Bin 2.0, I needed a way to remember where a file came from.&#0160; That way it can easily move the file back to it&#39;s original location.&#0160; I decided to create a file called RecycleBinManifest.xml to store this information (and other stuff).</p> <p>Just about every Recycle Bin command involves checking this file out, editing it and checking it back in.</p> <p><strong>Analysis</strong>   <br />This technique is probably not a good fit for something like Recycle Bin.&#0160; Hidden files work much better if the data isn&#39;t likely to change.&#0160; But if you need to constantly change the data, you run into problems:</p> <ul>
  <li>Multi-user issues.&#0160; Only 1 person can run a command at a time, since only 1 person can check out the file at a time.&#0160; If you want to guarantee only 1 user at a time, this is a good thing.&#0160; But for most commands, you want to allow multi-user workflows. </li>
  <li>Error handling.&#0160; If something goes wrong, the file might get stuck in a checked out state.&#0160; This will effectively prevent anyone else from running the command until the the checkout is undone.&#0160; In Recycle Bin&#39;s case, the undo checkout has to be done manually by an administrator.</li>
  <li>Replication.&#0160; If you are running in a connected workgroup environment, your site needs ownership of the file in order to check it out.&#0160; Recycle Bin gets around this by logging in to the workgroup that owns the file.&#0160; The downside is that operations are slower on other sites.</li>
  <li>Historical versions.&#0160; Every edit results in a new version of the file.&#0160; This means that you constantly need to purge old versions to avoid needless clutter.&#0160; On the plus side, there may be cases where you want to go back a version or two. </li>
 </ul>
-----
EXTENDED BODY:

-----
EXCERPT:

-----
KEYWORDS:
hidden files, replication, recycle bin
-----
COMMENT:
AUTHOR: activelive
EMAIL: vu.do@mylangroup.com
IP: 113.163.202.12
URL: 
DATE: 01/23/2011 10:04:19 PM

TITLE: Vault Query
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 1
CONVERT BREAKS: wysiwyg
ALLOW PINGS: 1
BASENAME: vault-query
CATEGORY: Sample Applications

UNIQUE URL: https://justonesandzeros.typepad.com/blog/2010/07/vault-query.html 
DATE: 07/19/2010 08:32:39 AM
-----
BODY:
<p><img alt="" src="https://justonesandzeros.typepad.com/images/SampleApp2.png" /> </p>
<p>Update:&#0160; The <a href="http://justonesandzeros.typepad.com/blog/2012/12/vault-query-2013.html" target="_self">Vault 2013 version</a> is now available.&#0160; Sorry, there is no 2012 version.</p>
<p>Time for another sample application.&#0160; This one is built specifically to help out Vault programmers, however I suspect that people will find other uses.</p>
<p>In a nutshell, Vault Query lets you make direct calls to the Web Service API.&#0160; The results are then displayed in a tree view, similar to the Visual Studio debugger.&#0160; This is a good way to sift through complex data, such as property mappings, lifecycle states or BOM data.</p>
<p>Just for fun, I decided to write this in WPF and give it an awesome UI.&#0160; <br /><a href="http://justonesandzeros.typepad.com/images/2010/VaultQuery/Screenshot.png" target="_blank"><img alt="" border="0" src="https://justonesandzeros.typepad.com/images/2010/VaultQuery/Screenshot_scaled.png" style="border: 0px none;" /></a>   <br /><span style="color: #808080;">(click image for full view)</span></p>
<p><strong>Requirements:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>To use the EXE   
<ul>
<li>.NET 3.5 </li>
<li>Vault 2011 Server (any version) installed on the network. </li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>To use the source code   
<ul>
<li>Visual Studio 2010 </li>
<li>Expression Blend 3 or 4 </li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<p><a href="http://justonesandzeros.typepad.com/Apps/VaultQuery/VaultQuery-1.0.1.0-bin.zip">Click here to download the application</a>   <br /><a href="http://justonesandzeros.typepad.com/Apps/VaultQuery/VaultQuery-1.0.1.0-src.zip">Click here to download the source code</a></p>
<p><strong>To use:   <br /></strong>This is a stand-alone EXE, so you don&#39;t need the Vault Client installed.&#0160; </p>
<p>On the left you have a list of operations.&#0160; Each operation represents a single web service call with specific input parameters.&#0160; Double click on the operation and it runs.&#0160; The output is presented in the right pane.</p>
<p>I set up a bunch of operations out-of-the-box, but you can add your own.&#0160; You can either use the &quot;Add Actions&quot; command or edit the Operations.xml file.&#0160; In theory, any API call can be made into an operation.&#0160; However the UI is picky about what input types it supports.&#0160; You may need to edit Operations.xml for many cases.</p>
<p><img alt="" src="https://justonesandzeros.typepad.com/images/2010/VaultQuery/NewOperation.png" /></p>
-----
EXTENDED BODY:

-----
EXCERPT:

-----
KEYWORDS:
Vault 2011, Web Service function, WPF
-----
--------
AUTHOR: Doug Redmond
AUTHOR EMAIL: doug.redmond@autodesk.com
TITLE: Localizing a Custom Command
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 1
CONVERT BREAKS: wysiwyg
ALLOW PINGS: 1
BASENAME: localizing-a-custom-command
CATEGORY: Concepts

UNIQUE URL: https://justonesandzeros.typepad.com/blog/2010/07/localizing-a-custom-command.html 
DATE: 07/12/2010 08:14:02 AM
-----
BODY:
<p><img src="https://justonesandzeros.typepad.com/images/Concepts2.png" /> </p> <p>Despite what some Americans may think, not everybody speaks English.&#0160; So it&#39;s sometimes a good idea for your Vault command to support multiple languages.&#0160; Since your command is a plug-in and not an EXE, there are some complications.</p> <p><strong><br />Satellite Assemblies:</strong> <br />Vault Explorer localization is based on the .NET concept of <em>Satellite Assemblies</em>.&#0160; If you are not familiar with that concept, you way want to read the relevant MSDN articles.</p> <p>In a nutshell, satellite assemblies are DLLs that contain the localized strings and dialogs for a specific language or locale.&#0160; At run time, every time a resource is needed, .NET attempts to find it in the appropriate satellite assembly.&#0160; If the resource is not found, the default resource is used.&#0160; The OS language is used to determine which satellite assembly to use.</p> <p><strong><br />Vault Explorer and your custom command:</strong> <br />For Vault Explorer, the default language is English.&#0160; If you install the English version of Vault, you get no satellite assemblies.&#0160; If you install a non-English version of Vault, you get everything the English install has plus the satellite assemblies for the install language.</p> <p>So you&#39;ve written a custom command for Vault Explorer.&#0160; For sake of demonstration, let&#39;s say you&#39;ve set up satellite assemblies for all the major languages.&#0160; Your control is .NET so it follows the .NET localization mechanism.&#0160; At runtime the <strong>OS language</strong> determines which satellite assembly is use.&#0160; <strong>The Vault install language is not a factor</strong>.</p> <p>This can lead to some interesting results.&#0160; Here a chart with some example set-ups and their results:</p> <table border="1" cellpadding="2" cellspacing="0" width="450"><tbody> <tr> <td valign="top" width="95"><strong>OS Language</strong></td> <td valign="top" width="107"><strong>Vault Install Language</strong></td> <td valign="top" width="105"><strong>Vault Runtime Language</strong></td> <td valign="top" width="141"><strong>Custom Command Runtime Language</strong></td> </tr> <tr> <td bgcolor="#ffc0cb" valign="top" width="95">English</td> <td bgcolor="#ffc0cb" valign="top" width="107">English</td> <td bgcolor="#ffc0cb" valign="top" width="105">English</td> <td bgcolor="#ffc0cb" valign="top" width="141">English</td> </tr> <tr> <td bgcolor="#ffc0cb" valign="top" width="95">German</td> <td bgcolor="#ffc0cb" valign="top" width="107">English</td> <td bgcolor="#ffc0cb" valign="top" width="105">English</td> <td bgcolor="#ffc0cb" valign="top" width="141">German</td> </tr> <tr> <td valign="top" width="95">English</td> <td valign="top" width="107">German</td> <td valign="top" width="105">English</td> <td valign="top" width="141">English</td> </tr> <tr> <td bgcolor="#ffc0cb" valign="top" width="95">German</td> <td bgcolor="#ffc0cb" valign="top" width="107">German</td> <td bgcolor="#ffc0cb" valign="top" width="105">German</td> <td bgcolor="#ffc0cb" valign="top" width="141">German</td> </tr> <tr> <td valign="top" width="95">French</td> <td valign="top" width="107">German</td> <td valign="top" width="105">English</td> <td valign="top" width="141">French</td> </tr> </tbody></table> <p>There is a pattern that emerges.&#0160; Vault runs as English (default language) if the install language doesn&#39;t match the OS language.&#0160; The custom command matches the OS language.&#0160; So we can create a more abstract grid...</p> <table border="1" cellpadding="2" cellspacing="0" width="450"><tbody> <tr> <td valign="top" width="95"><strong>OS Language</strong></td> <td valign="top" width="107"><strong>Vault Install Language</strong></td> <td valign="top" width="105"><strong>Vault Runtime Language</strong></td> <td valign="top" width="141"><strong>Custom Command Runtime Language</strong></td> </tr> <tr> <td bgcolor="#ffc0cb" valign="top" width="95">X</td> <td bgcolor="#ffc0cb" valign="top" width="107">X</td> <td bgcolor="#ffc0cb" valign="top" width="105">X</td> <td bgcolor="#ffc0cb" valign="top" width="141">X</td> </tr> <tr> <td valign="top" width="95">X</td> <td valign="top" width="107">Y</td> <td valign="top" width="105">English</td> <td valign="top" width="141">X</td> </tr> </tbody></table> <p>NOTE:&#0160; The highlighted configurations are the ones supported by Autodesk.</p> <p>&#0160; <br /><strong>Deployment:</strong></p> <p>Vault has several different language installs which are released at different times.&#0160; However your control doesn&#39;t have to follow this pattern.&#0160; In most cases, it will probably be easiest to support all your languages in a single deployment.&#0160; In other words, all the satellite assemblies are deployed at the same time.</p> <p><strong><br />Testing:</strong></p> <p>If you have an English OS and want to test out your localization, it can be a bit tricky to switch your OS language.&#0160; Changing the locale formats and keyboard settings in the Control Panel does <strong>not</strong> change the OS language. First you need to install the appropriate language pack.&#0160; Next, you need to set the “Display Language” from the Control Panel localization, which requires a reboot or re-login.</p> <br /> <p>That&#39;s all I have for this article.&#0160; Auf Wiedersehen. </p>
-----
EXTENDED BODY:

-----
EXCERPT:

-----
KEYWORDS:
localization, satellite assemblies, custom command
-----
--------
AUTHOR: Doug Redmond
AUTHOR EMAIL: doug.redmond@autodesk.com
TITLE: Properties in Vault 2011 - Part 4
STATUS: Publish
ALLOW COMMENTS: 1
CONVERT BREAKS: wysiwyg
ALLOW PINGS: 1
BASENAME: properties-in-vault-2011---part-4
CATEGORY: Tips and Tricks

UNIQUE URL: https://justonesandzeros.typepad.com/blog/2010/07/properties-in-vault-2011---part-4.html 
DATE: 07/07/2010 11:31:05 AM
-----
BODY:
<p><img src="https://justonesandzeros.typepad.com/images/TipsAndTricks2.png" /> </p> <p>This posting is all about source code.&#0160; Here you will find useful code snippets for dealing with properties.&#0160; </p> <p><strong>How to get the list of legal values for a property definition</strong>   <br />If you have a property definition that contains a list of legal values, you need to get the PropDefInfo object to read that list of values.&#0160; GetPropertyDefinitionInfosByEntityClassId is the only way to get this object, but it seems that you need to be an administrator to call this function.&#0160; There is an <strong>undocumented trick</strong> to get this information with normal permissions.&#0160; Pass in null to the &#39;<em>propertyDefIds</em>&#39; parameter.&#0160; It will return all PropDefInfo objects and it will remove the admin requirement.</p> <table border="1" cellpadding="2" cellspacing="0" width="450"><tbody>   <tr>    <td valign="top" width="450">     <p class="MsoNormal" style="line-height: normal; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span color="#008000" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: green; font-size: 10pt;">// C#&#0160; <br /></span></span><span color="#008000" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: green; font-size: 10pt;">&#0160; <br /></span></span></p>     <span color="#008000" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: green; font-size: 10pt;">// Get all file PropDefInfo objects       <br /></span></span><span color="#2b91af" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="line-height: 115%; font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: #2b91af; font-size: 10pt;">PropDefInfo</span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="line-height: 115%; font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;">[] propDefs = propSvc.GetPropertyDefinitionInfosByEntityClassId(<font color="#a31515"><span style="color: #a31515;">&quot;FILE&quot;</span></font></span>, <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">null</span></font>);</span></td>   </tr>   <tr>    <td valign="top" width="450">     <p class="MsoNormal" style="line-height: normal; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span color="#008000" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: green; font-size: 10pt;"></span></span></p>     <p class="MsoNormal" style="line-height: normal; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span color="#008000" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: green; font-size: 10pt;">&#39; VB.NET        <br />        <br /></span></span><span color="#008000" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: green; font-size: 10pt;">&#39; Get all file PropDefInfo objects        <br /></span></span><span color="#0000ff" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="line-height: 115%; font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: blue; font-size: 10pt;">Dim</span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="line-height: 115%; font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"> propDefs <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">As</span></font></span> PropDefInfo() = propSvc.GetPropertyDefinitionInfosByEntityClassId(<font color="#a31515"><span style="color: #a31515;">&quot;FILE&quot;</span></font>, <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Nothing</span></font>)        <p></p>       </span></p>    </td>   </tr>  </tbody></table> <p><strong>How to look up a system property</strong>   <br />For system properties it&#39;s OK to hardcode the system name since the name will be the same in all vaults and languages.&#0160; FindPropertyDefinitionsBySystemNames is the API function to use and it&#39;s pretty straightforward in how it works.&#0160; The trick is finding the system name.&#0160; In the properties dialog, you can customize the columns to show the system name of each property definition.</p> <p><img src="https://justonesandzeros.typepad.com/images/2010/PropertiesInVault2011/SystemNameColumn_scaled.png" /> </p> <p>Note that the systems names are nice and simple.&#0160; However any UDPs that you create will have a randomly generated GUID attached to them.&#0160; So the system name is not a good way to look up UDPs.</p> <p><strong>How to look up a mapped property</strong>   <br />Sometimes all you care about is the file property and you want to see the vault PropDef that has a read mapping to that file property.&#0160; Hardcoding the system name isn&#39;t helpful since UDP names and property mappings may change from vault to vault.</p> <p>What you need is to find the moniker for the file property and use that file to find the vault PropDef.&#0160; Note: there may be no mappings or multiple mappings to the file property.</p> <table border="1" cellpadding="2" cellspacing="0" width="450"><tbody>   <tr>    <td valign="top" width="450"><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="line-height: 115%; font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;">       <p class="MsoNormal" style="line-height: normal; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><font color="#008000" face="Courier New" size="2"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: green; font-size: 10pt;">// the moniker for the &quot;Company&quot; property in an Inventor file.          <br /></span></font></p></span><span color="#0000ff" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: blue; font-size: 10pt;">string</span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"> moniker = <font color="#a31515"><span style="color: #a31515;">&quot;15!{D5CDD502-2E9C-101B-9397-08002B2CF9AE}!nvarchar&quot;</span></font></span>;          <br />          <br /></span><span color="#2b91af" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: #2b91af; font-size: 10pt;">List</span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;">&lt;<font color="#2b91af"><span style="color: #2b91af;">PropDefInfo</span></font></span>&gt; mappedToContent = <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">new</span></font> <font color="#2b91af"><span style="color: #2b91af;">List</span></font>&lt;<font color="#2b91af"><span style="color: #2b91af;">PropDefInfo</span></font>&gt;();          <br /></span><span color="#0000ff" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: blue; font-size: 10pt;">foreach</span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"> (<font color="#2b91af"><span style="color: #2b91af;">PropDefInfo</span></font></span> propDef <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">in</span></font> propDefs)          <br /></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;">{          <br /></span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">bool</span></font></span> matchFound = <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">false</span></font>;          <br />          <br /></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">if</span></font></span> (propDef.EntClassCtntSrcPropCfgArray == <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">null</span></font>)          <br /></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">continue</span></font></span>;          <br />          <br /></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">foreach</span></font></span> (<font color="#2b91af"><span style="color: #2b91af;">EntClassCtntSrcPropCfg</span></font> contentSource <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">in</span></font> propDef.EntClassCtntSrcPropCfgArray)          <br /></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span>{          <br /></span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">if</span></font></span> (contentSource.EntClassId != <font color="#a31515"><span style="color: #a31515;">&quot;FILE&quot;</span></font> || contentSource.CtntSrcPropDefArray == <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">null</span></font>)          <br /></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;;          <br />          <br /></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; i++)          <br /></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span>{          <br /></span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;          <br /></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">break</span></font></span>;          <br /></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">if</span></font></span> (matchFound)          <br /></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">break</span></font></span>;          <br /></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span>}          <br /></span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="line-height: 115%; font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;">}          <p></p>         </span></span>      </span></td>   </tr>   <tr>    <td valign="top" width="450">     <p class="MsoNormal" style="line-height: normal; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span color="#008000" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: green; font-size: 10pt;">        <br />&#39; the moniker for the &quot;Company&quot; property in an Inventor file.        <br /></span></span><span color="#0000ff" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;;          <br />          <br /></span></font></span><span color="#0000ff" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: blue; font-size: 10pt;">Dim</span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: blue; font-size: 10pt;">For</span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"> <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Each</span></font></span> propDef <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">As</span></font> PropDefInfo <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">In</span></font> propDefs        <br /></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Dim</span></font></span> matchFound <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">As</span></font> <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Boolean</span></font> = <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">False          <br />          <br /></span></font></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">If</span></font></span> propDef.EntClassCtntSrcPropCfgArray <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Is</span></font> <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Nothing</span></font> <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Then          <br /></span></font></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Continue</span></font></span> <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">For          <br /></span></font></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">End</span></font></span> <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">If          <br />          <br /></span></font></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">For</span></font></span> <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Each</span></font> contentSource <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">As</span></font> EntClassCtntSrcPropCfg <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">In</span></font> propDef.EntClassCtntSrcPropCfgArray        <br /></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">If</span></font></span> contentSource.EntClassId &lt;&gt; <font color="#a31515"><span style="color: #a31515;">&quot;FILE&quot;</span></font> <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">OrElse</span></font> contentSource.CtntSrcPropDefArray <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Is</span></font> <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Nothing</span></font> <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Then          <br /></span></font></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Continue</span></font></span> <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">For          <br /></span></font></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">End</span></font></span> <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">If          <br />          <br /></span></font></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">For</span></font></span> i <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">As</span></font> <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Integer</span></font> = 0 <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">To</span></font> contentSource.CtntSrcPropDefArray.Length - 1        <br /></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">If</span></font></span> contentSource.CtntSrcPropDefArray(i).Moniker = moniker <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">AndAlso</span></font> contentSource.MapDirectionArray(i) = MappingDirection.Read <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Then          <br /></span></font></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span>mappedToContent.Add(propDef)        <br /></span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span>matchFound = <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">True          <br /></span></font></span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Exit</span></font></span> <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">For          <br /></span></font></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">End</span></font></span> <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">If          <br /></span></font></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Next          <br /></span></font></span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">If</span></font></span> matchFound <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Then          <br /></span></font></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Exit</span></font></span> <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">For          <br /></span></font></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">End</span></font></span> <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">If          <br /></span></font></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Next          <br /></span></font></span></span><span color="#0000ff" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="line-height: 115%; font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: blue; font-size: 10pt;">Next</span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="line-height: 115%; font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;">        <p></p>       </span></span></p>    </td>   </tr>  </tbody></table> <p><strong>How to find the moniker</strong>   <br />This is a bit tricky.&#0160; I don&#39;t recommend trying to figure out the syntax we use.&#0160; Instead I recommend the following:</p> <ol>
  <li>Create a new UDP and map it to the property within the file. </li>
  <li>Write a code snippet that gets the PropDefInfo object for your UDP. </li>
  <li>In the debugger expand out the <em>EntClassCtntSrcPropCfgArray</em> of the PropDefInfo object. </li>
  <li>You should be able to find the mapping along with the moniker value. </li>
  <li>Copy the moniker value into your code. </li>
 </ol>
 <p><img src="https://justonesandzeros.typepad.com/images/2010/PropertiesInVault2011/debugWatch.png" /> </p> <p><strong>How to find the CtntSrc object for a file   <br /></strong>CtntSrc is the object representing a content source provider.&#0160; Each file will have 1 and only 1 provider.&#0160; You can locate the correct object using the Provider system property on a file.</p> <table border="1" cellpadding="2" cellspacing="0" width="450"><tbody>   <tr>    <td valign="top" width="450">     <p class="MsoNormal" style="line-height: normal; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span color="#2b91af" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: #2b91af; font-size: 10pt;">IEnumerable</span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;">&lt;<font color="#2b91af"><span style="color: #2b91af;">PropDefInfo</span></font></span>&gt; results = propDefInfos.Where(prop =&gt; prop.PropDef.SysName == <font color="#a31515"><span style="color: #a31515;">&quot;Provider&quot;</span></font>);        <br /></span><span color="#2b91af" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: #2b91af; font-size: 10pt;">PropDefInfo</span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"> providerProp = results.First();        <br />        <br /></span></span><span color="#2b91af" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: #2b91af; font-size: 10pt;">PropInst</span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;">[] values = propSvc.GetProperties(<font color="#a31515"><span style="color: #a31515;">&quot;FILE&quot;</span></font></span>, <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">new</span></font> <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">long</span></font>[] { file.Id }, <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">new</span></font> <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">long</span></font>[] { providerProp.PropDef.Id });        <br /></span><span color="#0000ff" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: blue; font-size: 10pt;">string</span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"> providerName = (<font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">string</span></font></span>)values[0].Val;        <br />        <br /></span><span color="#2b91af" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: #2b91af; font-size: 10pt;">ServerCfg</span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"> config = adminSvc.GetServerConfiguration();        <br />        <br /></span></span><span color="#2b91af" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: #2b91af; font-size: 10pt;">IEnumerable</span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;">&lt;<font color="#2b91af"><span style="color: #2b91af;">CtntSrc</span></font></span>&gt; providers = config.CtntSrcArray.Where(source =&gt; source.DispName == providerName);        <br /></span><span color="#0000ff" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: blue; font-size: 10pt;">if</span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"> (providers.Count() == 0)        <br /></span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span>providers = config.CtntSrcArray.Where(source =&gt; source.SysName == <font color="#a31515"><span style="color: #a31515;">&quot;IFilter&quot;</span></font></span>);        <br /></span><span color="#2b91af" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: #2b91af; font-size: 10pt;">CtntSrc</span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"> provider = providers.First();</span></span></p>    </td>   </tr>   <tr>    <td valign="top" width="450">     <p class="MsoNormal" style="line-height: normal; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span color="#0000ff" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: blue; font-size: 10pt;">        <br />Dim</span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"> results <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">As</span></font></span> IEnumerable(<font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Of</span></font> PropDefInfo) = <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">From</span></font> propDefInfo <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">In</span></font> propDefInfos _        <br /></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Where</span></font></span> propDefInfo.PropDef.SysName = <font color="#a31515"><span style="color: #a31515;">&quot;Provider&quot;</span></font> _        <br /></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Select</span></font></span> propDefInfo        <br /></span><span color="#0000ff" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: blue; font-size: 10pt;">Dim</span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"> providerProp <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">As</span></font></span> PropDefInfo = results.First()        <br />        <br /></span><span color="#0000ff" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: blue; font-size: 10pt;">Dim</span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"> values <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">As</span></font></span> PropInst() = propSvc.GetProperties(<font color="#a31515"><span style="color: #a31515;">&quot;FILE&quot;</span></font>, <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">New</span></font> <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Long</span></font>() {file.Id}, <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">New</span></font> <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Long</span></font>() {providerProp.PropDef.Id})        <br /></span><span color="#0000ff" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: blue; font-size: 10pt;">Dim</span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"> providerName <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">As</span></font></span> <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">String</span></font> = <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">DirectCast</span></font>(values(0).Val, <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">String</span></font>)        <br />        <br /></span><span color="#0000ff" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: blue; font-size: 10pt;">Dim</span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"> config <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">As</span></font></span> ServerCfg = adminSvc.GetServerConfiguration()        <br />        <br /></span><span color="#0000ff" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: blue; font-size: 10pt;">Dim</span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"> providers <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">As</span></font></span> IEnumerable(<font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Of</span></font> CtntSrc) = <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">From</span></font> source <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">In</span></font> config.CtntSrcArray _        <br /></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Where</span></font></span> source.DispName = providerName _        <br /></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Select</span></font></span> source        <br /></span><span color="#0000ff" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: blue; font-size: 10pt;">If</span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"> providers.Count() = 0 <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Then          <br /></span></font></span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span>providers = config.CtntSrcArray.Where(<font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Function</span></font></span>(source) source.SysName = <font color="#a31515"><span style="color: #a31515;">&quot;IFilter&quot;</span></font>)        <br /></span><span color="#0000ff" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: blue; font-size: 10pt;">End</span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"> <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">If          <br /></span></font></span></span><span color="#0000ff" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: blue; font-size: 10pt;">Dim</span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"> provider <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">As</span></font></span> CtntSrc = providers.First()        <p></p>       </span></p>    </td>   </tr>  </tbody></table> <p>Note:&#0160; &quot;IFilter&quot; is the system name to the &quot;All Files&quot; provider.&#0160; This should be used if the provider value is blank or there is no match to any other provider.</p> <p><strong>How to update a UDP value on a file</strong>   <br />There are two ways of doing this.&#0160; The correct way depends on if the UDP is mapped or not.</p> <p>The unmapped UDP is the simple case, you just call UpdateFileProperties.&#0160; If the UDP has a read mapping, <strong>UpdateFileProperties will not help you</strong>.&#0160; The reason is because when the file is checked in, the file&#39;s internal value will overwrite the UDP value you just set.&#0160; The correct thing to do is to update the property inside the local file before checking it back in to Vault.&#0160; This means that you need to use the appropriate CAD API to set the file data.&#0160; Once the file is checked in, the Vault server will update the mapped UDP value</p> <table border="1" cellpadding="2" cellspacing="0" width="450"><tbody>   <tr>    <td valign="top" width="450">     <p class="MsoNormal" style="line-height: normal; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span color="#008000" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: green; font-size: 10pt;">// TODO: checkout file</span></span><span color="#008000" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: green; font-size: 10pt;">        <br />       </span></span></p>     <p class="MsoNormal" style="line-height: normal; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span color="#0000ff" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: blue; font-size: 10pt;">if</span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"> (isMapped)        <br /></span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;">{        <br /></span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#008000"><span style="color: green;">// TODO: update local file with CAD API          <br /></span></font></span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;">}        <br /></span></span><span color="#0000ff" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: blue; font-size: 10pt;">else        <br /></span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;">{        <br /></span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#008000"><span style="color: green;">// TODO: call UpdateFileProperties          <br /></span></font></span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;">}</span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;">        <br />       </span></span></p>     <p class="MsoNormal" style="line-height: normal; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span color="#008000" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: green; font-size: 10pt;">// TODO: checkin file</span></span></p>    </td>   </tr>  </tbody></table> <p><strong>How to tell if a UDP is mapped</strong></p> <p>Here is code to determine if a property has a read mapping or not.&#0160; Since each provider sets its own mappings, you need the CtntSrc object from the earlier section.</p> <table border="1" cellpadding="2" cellspacing="0" width="450"><tbody>   <tr>    <td valign="top" width="450">     <p class="MsoNormal" style="line-height: normal; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span color="#2b91af" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: #2b91af; font-size: 10pt;">IEnumerable</span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;">&lt;<font color="#2b91af"><span style="color: #2b91af;">PropDefInfo</span></font></span>&gt; results = propDefInfos.Where(prop =&gt; prop.PropDef.Id == propDefId);        <br /></span><span color="#2b91af" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: #2b91af; font-size: 10pt;">PropDefInfo</span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"> theProperty = results.First();        <br />        <br /></span></span><span color="#0000ff" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: blue; font-size: 10pt;">bool</span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"> isMapped = <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">false</span></font></span>;        <br /></span><span color="#0000ff" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: blue; font-size: 10pt;">if</span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"> (theProperty.EntClassCtntSrcPropCfgArray != <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">null</span></font></span>)        <br /></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;">{        <br /></span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">foreach</span></font></span> (<font color="#2b91af"><span style="color: #2b91af;">EntClassCtntSrcPropCfg</span></font> contentSource <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">in</span></font> theProperty.EntClassCtntSrcPropCfgArray)        <br /></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span>{        <br /></span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">if</span></font></span> (contentSource.EntClassId != <font color="#a31515"><span style="color: #a31515;">&quot;FILE&quot;</span></font> || contentSource.CtntSrcPropDefArray == <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">null</span></font>)        <br /></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">continue</span></font></span>;        <br />        <br /></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; i &lt; contentSource.CtntSrcPropDefArray.Length; i++)&#0160; <br /></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span>{        <br /></span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">if</span></font></span> (contentSource.CtntSrcPropDefArray[i].CtntSrcId == provider.Id &amp;&amp;        <br /></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span>{        <br /></span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;;        <br /></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span>}        <br /></span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span>}        <br /></span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span>}        <br /></span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: blue; font-size: 10pt;">Dim</span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"> isMapped <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">As</span></font></span> <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Boolean</span></font> = <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">False          <br /></span></font></span><span color="#0000ff" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: blue; font-size: 10pt;">If</span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"> theProperty.EntClassCtntSrcPropCfgArray <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">IsNot</span></font></span> <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Nothing</span></font> <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Then          <br /></span></font></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">For</span></font></span> <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Each</span></font> contentSource <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">As</span></font> EntClassCtntSrcPropCfg <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">In</span></font> theProperty.EntClassCtntSrcPropCfgArray        <br /></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">If</span></font></span> contentSource.EntClassId &lt;&gt; <font color="#a31515"><span style="color: #a31515;">&quot;FILE&quot;</span></font> <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">OrElse</span></font> contentSource.CtntSrcPropDefArray <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Is</span></font> <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Nothing</span></font> <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Then          <br /></span></font></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Continue</span></font></span> <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">For          <br /></span></font></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">End</span></font></span> <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">If          <br />          <br /></span></font></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">For</span></font></span> i <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">As</span></font> <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Integer</span></font> = 0 <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">To</span></font> contentSource.CtntSrcPropDefArray.Length - 1        <br />        <br /></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">If</span></font></span> contentSource.CtntSrcPropDefArray(i).CtntSrcId = provider.Id <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">AndAlso</span></font> contentSource.MapDirectionArray(i) = MappingDirection.Read <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Then          <br /></span></font></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span>isMapped = <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">True          <br /></span></font></span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">End</span></font></span> <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">If          <br /></span></font></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Next          <br /></span></font></span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"><span>&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160;&#0160; </span><font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">Next          <br /></span></font></span></span><span color="#0000ff" size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; color: blue; font-size: 10pt;">End</span></span><span size="2;" style="font-family: Courier New"><span style="font-family: &quot;Courier New&quot;; font-size: 10pt;"> <font color="#0000ff"><span style="color: blue;">If</span></font></span></span></p>    </td>   </tr>  </tbody></table> <p><strong>Conclusion</strong>   <br />That&#39;s all I have planned for my series on properties.&#0160; If more questions/issues come in, I may decide to add a part 5.   <br />Thanks to everyone for all the great feedback.</p> <p>Coming in July:&#0160; A series of articles on connected workgroups (aka. Replication)</p>

COMMENT:
AUTHOR: Nathan Bell

IP: 207.255.97.3
URL: 
DATE: 06/20/2011 08:46:27 AM
Hello.  Is there a way to ensure that when using batch plot all the iproperties and mass properties are updated?  I ask because lately when a project is finished and someone wants a set of drawings, the batch plot command prints out every bill of material in every drawing differently- some with the iproperties right in the BOM and some with no properties.  Often times the BOM is right but in assemblies the mtotal mass still says "NA".  I can print out each drawing individually and update all properties one at a time, but if there are 100 drawings in a set that can take hours on end.
-----
COMMENT:
AUTHOR: Doug Redmond
EMAIL: 
IP: 72.52.96.11
URL: http://profile.typepad.com/6p0120a5728249970b
DATE: 06/20/2011 03:37:42 PM
You can't alter the batch plot command.  
One option is to write your own batch plot command.  That way you can control exactly what gets plotted.

If you think Vault is incorrectly plotting the wrong data, please let our product support team know.

COMMENT:
AUTHOR: Forrest Judd
EMAIL: ForrestJudd@hagerman.com
IP: 173.51.1.106
URL: 
DATE: 04/11/2012 07:10:46 PM
If a UDP is mapped from Vault to the document only, UpdateFileProperties will still work, right?
-----
COMMENT:
AUTHOR: Doug Redmond
EMAIL: 
IP: 72.52.96.11
URL: http://profile.typepad.com/6p0120a5728249970b
DATE: 04/12/2012 08:32:39 AM
That depends on what you mean by working.  The value should update properly in Vault.  But the file itself will still have the old value.  File modification always has to be done client-side.

AUTHOR: nicole
EMAIL: diamocidelverde@libero.it
IP: 88.213.145.148
URL: 
DATE: 02/10/2013 02:51:47 AM
Hi,
I'm on the beginig.
Could someone help me, I tryed to update an item property in this way:
 m_mgr.ItemService.UpdateItemProperties({selection.Id}, {60}, {"test"})
but i get allways this soap error:
soap exception 1321.
I'm secure the item selection is correct.What's wrong?
Thanks
-----
COMMENT:
AUTHOR: Doug Redmond
EMAIL: 
IP: 8.19.13.28
URL: http://profile.typepad.com/6p0120a5728249970b
DATE: 02/11/2013 07:47:42 AM
The first parameter to UpdateItemProperties should be an array of Revision IDs.  You are passing in the selection ID, which is the the Item ID.  Item ID is different than Revision ID.
Call GetItemsByIds to find the Revision ID.

See this article for more info on selection.Id values:  <a href="http://justonesandzeros.typepad.com/blog/2011/06/file-versions-and-links-in-the-selection-set.html">http://justonesandzeros.typepad.com/blog/2011/06/file-versions-and-links-in-the-selection-set.html</a>

-----

EMAIL: 
IP: 8.19.13.27

Did you call EditItem before calling UpdateItemProperties? 
If you want to see an example, go to the Vault Customization discussion group:  <a href="http://forums.autodesk.com/t5/Autodesk-Vault-Customization/Populating-Item-UDPs/m-p/3643626/highlight/true#M1018">http://forums.autodesk.com/t5/Autodesk-Vault-Customization/Populating-Item-UDPs/m-p/3643626/highlight/true#M1018</a>

COMMENT:
AUTHOR: Nicole
EMAIL: diamocidelverde@libero.it
IP: 88.51.20.233

Thanks for your answer,

-----
COMMENT:
AUTHOR: Doug Redmond
EMAIL: 
IP: 8.19.13.27
URL: http://profile.typepad.com/6p0120a5728249970b
DATE: 02/21/2013 08:08:30 AM
Description is a system property.  You can't edit those directly.  File Size is a better example.  The system automatically handles that value.  It makes no sense to update that value with an UpdateProperties function.  

Also, don't assume that Description will have a value of 60.  That might not be true for all Vaults, and it might not be true if you upgrade to the next release.  Use the system name if you want a reliable key.
-----

Hello Doug,
We have situation which lead to conclusion that properties update makes file ‘dirty’, that’s mean trigger checked out/update/bump the version any other assembly using  this file.
The issue is explained below with two scenarios:
Scenario 1:
1.	open file from the vault (no files in C-drive workspace) 
 
2.	Hit OK  for Check-out the file:
 
3.	Message will appear about updating the properties:" Some prperties in the file ... may be out of the date. Would you like to update properties now?"
 

4.	For this Scenario 1 choose “Yes”, and the result :file is dirty (with*):
 

Scenario 2:
1.	open the same file from the vault (no files in C-drive workspace ) 
 
2.	Hit OK for Check out the file.
 
3.	Message will appear:" Some prperties in the file ... may be out of the date. Would you like to update properties now?"
 
4.	For this Scenario 2 choose “No”, and result is file is clean:
   
 
Conclusion: properties updates make files dirty and it constantly dirty every time when this file is checked-out.

Qestions:
1.	How to fix issue with constant ‘dirty’ files after updating properties?
2.	Where  to start to resolve this?
3.	How to see which particular properties are ’out of the date?’

COMMENT:
AUTHOR: Doug Redmond
EMAIL: 
IP: 132.188.64.218
URL: http://profile.typepad.com/6p0120a5728249970b
DATE: 09/27/2013 07:28:30 AM
Yes, an update of properties results in a new file version.

It sounds like your issues are with the product itself and not the API.  I suggest posting your questions to the Vault discussion group:  <a href="http://forums.autodesk.com/t5/Autodesk-Vault/bd-p/101">http://forums.autodesk.com/t5/Autodesk-Vault/bd-p/101</a>

Is it possible to update the Comment field of an earlier version. The...our...revision table is set to use the comment field as the Description of the changes made. However, human error as it is...people sometimes forget to enter the changes before clicking OK when changing the state back to Released. I'd like to be able to right click on a version and add those comments after the fact. I have my extension to the point of adding comments to a form...I just can't figure out how to persist those comments to the drawing file.
-----
COMMENT:
AUTHOR: Doug Redmond
EMAIL: 
IP: 24.11.44.223
URL: http://profile.typepad.com/6p0120a5728249970b
DATE: 11/28/2013 09:28:35 AM
Sorry, you can't edit historical comments.  
I recommend making Comment a required property and putting a condition on the state change that Property Compliance must be true.  That will prevent people from releasing files that have an empty comment.

AUTHOR: Randy
EMAIL: rsimington@evansonline.com

-----
COMMENT:
AUTHOR: Randy
EMAIL: rsimington@evansonline.com
IP: 159.18.23.2
URL: 
DATE: 11/28/2013 04:51:29 PM
"A comment string set by the user. If CheckedOut is true, then this property contains the comment set during checkout. If CheckedOut is false, then this property contains the comment set during check-in. Checking in a file, resets the comment for that version." Taken from the VaultAPI documentation. Reading that, shouldn't I be able to check out the version in question and update the comment on check in. Will this create a new version? In essence rolling back the part or will it just update that version?
-----
COMMENT:
AUTHOR: Doug Redmond
EMAIL: 
IP: 24.120.169.130
URL: http://profile.typepad.com/6p0120a5728249970b
DATE: 12/03/2013 04:46:00 PM
No, because the new version is created at checkout time, not checkin time.

For example, you add a new file to vault.  So there is only one version of the file.  When you run the checkout command, v2 is immediately created.  The checkout comment is on v2 and v1 has the comment that was provided when the file was initially added.
-----
